intro: Glochidion marojejiense, commonly known as the Marojejii glabrous hibiscus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine, stinging hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming during the wet season. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Glochidion marojejiense is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
